page.title: 16A Park/Museum ,Wolverhampton
page.content: Bantock House was built in the mid 18th Century.It was first called New Merridale Farm,then Merridale House and finally Bantock House as it is known to-day.In 1866 Mr.Thomas Bantock farmed there.He had 10 children and 6 servants.When Thomas died,his son, Albert Baldwin Bantock,took over and lived there with his wife and servants. He had no children.Albert liked collecting.He also served on the council and later became Mayor.When he died he left the house,grounds and collection to the town.This collection has since been improved by donations from other people.The museum houses collections of enamels,Japanning, crockery,dolls and toys.Another part of the building is used as a district library.The grounds include a child's playground and a miniature golf course.
